title: The Unfathomable Logic of League's Ranking System
body: First of all, I was recently demoted from Gold 3 to Silver 5, so as you can imagine I am rather pissed. I'd like to know why Riot believes players deserve to not only be demoted but to have their mmr drastically lowered if their teammates disconnect or feed. I now lose 25 points for losses, regardless of whether there was anything I could have done, and gain only 10 points for wins, regardless of how well I do. This removes much of my incentive to even play the game and it truly seems like Riot enjoys creating toxicity. Is there something I can do about this, or is it genuinely my fault if my marksman flashes into the enemy team, dies, and costs us the game?

Too confident in your own ability and blaming bad team mates for losing, classic bronzie attitude. Fact is you dropped 7 divisions pretty fast, something that can't be fully attributed to matchmaking or "bad team mates". And honestly there's not much difference between the skill level of silver and low gold, it's quite easy to be carried to gold.

I typically don't "get carried." I'm a Thresh main and I'm used to landing the game-winning hook on the enemy marksman at 50 minutes. But the reason I win those games is not because I landed the hook but because my teammates decide to follow up after I landed it. When they do nothing, my effort is meaningless.

Rito confirmed this season was gonna be really hard.

Your MMR is wait for it...                             http://i.imgur.com/7tusIzp.png

> Welcome to ELO hell

> Gold 3 to Silver 5

You dropped 3 divisions straight, I don't think it's entirely the system's fault, I doubt it is even half the culprit.

Since you know, when you get d/c's the enemies get them too (not to mention enemies have more chances of getting d/c if you're not the one dropping out mid match), unless you're just that unlucky then oh well. 

It's an online game, the company can not physically force everyone to stay once a match is started or check their net prior to play, it's just not possible. Then you have a few other factors in play, like their computer/router codition, the launcher's condition, the server's condition, the ISP's condition and the fact the match has 10 complete strangers from different places connecting to this one single match, therefore disconnections is and should be expected in solo queue.

This is why solo queue is half grind and half skill, and it's no surprise nor is it Riot's fault, it is just that way when you have a team game with solo queue. The grind portion is made up by d/cs, rage quits, trolls etc.

If you wanna avoid the grind bit completely, play 5s.

> You dropped 3 divisions straight

I think you miscounted.

You're correct, my mind fked up and thought it goes like this from low to high S5=>G1=>G2=>G3.

So yes, he actually dropped 7 if I am not wrong again.

Oh well, I can say that I was just trying not to be too harsh.
Riot is funnelling out all the weak minded who cant stop themselves from ______. And its your fault for not stopping them or getting your whole team to back them up.
